data.title: Martin Lawrence To Perform First Stand-Up Special In 14 Years
data.meta_description: The legendary comedian teamed up with Showtime for the long-awaited special.
data.text:
It’s been 14 years since Martin Lawrence’s 2002 Runteldat special and while Martin has made fans laugh in various comedies since then, many have longed for the comedian to take the stage for another stand-up special. Now, the wait is over.

SHOWTIME and Lawrence announced yesterday that the network and comedian have teamed up in a new special, Martin Lawrence Doin’ Time: Uncut.

Filmed live at the Orpheum Theatre in Los Angeles, the special will touch on Hollywood, sex and relationships, President Obama, Bill Cosby, and more.

WANT MORE FROM ESSENCE? Subscribe to our daily newsletter for the latest in hair, beauty, style and celebrity news

Lawrence told Variety, “I look forward to having my third concert film premiere on Showtime. Fourteen years is a long time between concert specials and I am excited to know that my TV audience will be able to enjoy this show as if they came to see me live.”

The special comes on the heels of Lawrence’s national tour and will premiere Friday, September 9 at 9p.m. ET.
